title: Promisifed webpack returns errors as a return value
body:
<!-- Please don't delete this template because we'll close your issue -->
<!-- Before creating an issue please make sure you are using the latest version of webpack. -->

# Bug report

<!-- Please ask questions on StackOverflow or the webpack Gitter. -->
<!-- https://stackoverflow.com/questions/ask?tags=webpack -->
<!-- https://gitter.im/webpack/webpack -->
<!-- Issues which contain questions or support requests will be closed. -->

**What is the current behavior?**

When using promisify on Webpack as follows: `const asyncWebpack = promisify(webpack);`, any compilation errors are returned as a value rather than thrown.

**If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce.**

1. require and promisify Webpack
2. attempt to compile a file with a local require that does not exist

the result will be that a "dist" folder is not created but Webpack throws no error. (although does specify the error in it's return value)

This is my configuration: 

```js

const webpack = require("webpack");
const asyncWebpack = promisify(webpack);

// ...

// the following code is in a try / catch block

const result = await asyncWebpack({
  target: "node",
  entry: join(process.cwd(), normalize(folder), index),
  mode: "production",
  output: {
    library: name,
    libraryTarget: "umd",
    filename: join(name, index)
  },
  plugins: [new webpack.IgnorePlugin(/^hiredis*/)],
  externals: ["aws-sdk"]
});

// result contains error information!

```

<!-- A great way to do this is to provide your configuration via a GitHub repository -->
<!-- The most helpful is a minimal reproduction with instructions on how to reproduce -->
<!-- Repositories with too many files or large `webpack.config.js` files are not suitable -->

**What is the expected behavior?**

Webpack should throw an error upon compilation issues.

<!-- "It should work" is not a helpful explanation -->
<!-- Explain exactly how it should behave -->

**Other relevant information:**

webpack version:  ^4.17.2
Node.js version: v11.0.0
Operating System: macOS Mojave
